entries.excerpt: Humans are capable of atrocious cruelty – the history of war makes this all too clear. How many died in war? And what are the prospects for making the world more peaceful?
entries.kpi: • Over the last decade the annual number of deaths from conflicts was 100,000 globally.

entries.title: Military Personnel and Spending
entries.excerpt: How large are countries’ militaries? How much do they spend on their armed forces? Explore global data on military personnel and spending.
entries.kpi: • Annual military spending amounts to 2.2% of global GDP.

entries.title: Terrorism
entries.excerpt: The attacks of terrorists receive a lot of attention from the media and often dominate the public discourse. How many people die from these attacks and how did it change over time?
entries.kpi: • Over the last decade the annual number of deaths due to terrorism was 26,000 globally.

entries.title: Nuclear Weapons
entries.excerpt: The world’s nuclear powers possess around 9,500 nuclear warheads in total. These weapons have the capacity to kill hundreds of millions of people directly, and billions due to subsequent effects on agriculture.
entries.kpi: The world’s nuclear powers have more than 9,000 nuclear warheads.

entries.title: Violence Against Children and Children’s Rights
entries.excerpt: How common is physical and emotional violence against children? How did it change over time?
entries.kpi: Violence against children in various forms has fallen, but still occurs today.

entries.title: Homicides
entries.excerpt: How common are homicides? How does this differ across countries? And how is this changing over time? Explore global data on homicides.
entries.kpi: Globally around 400,000 people die from homicide each year.
